nodes.text: Remain courteous, respectful and if possible friendly
Make it clear that your company does not allow you to make payments of this kind / that your head office doesn’t allow me to pay any fee that isn’t official
Ask for name and official title of person asking and any identity number
State that you would need an official receipt if you were to pay the fee
Ask to speak to the supervisor/manager of the person making the demand to discuss why you cant pay
Mention that you will contact the embassy / consulate to discuss / report the issue
Explain that you must call your company first to report the issue and to get permission to pay the fee
Take notes or make mental note of the conversations and the time and place for a later report
Report it
If you feel that your safety or liberty is threatened and you are being coerced into paying, then you should pay.
You must record the payment and the circumstances and report them as soon as possible to your line manager and the legal or compliance department.

Giving an unearned reward to influence someone’s behaviour or approving an irregular payment to facilitate business processes is a form of bribery.  It is illegal.  This especially includes being asked for a fee by a customer to arrange signatures. This is and could be interpreted by others as a bribe.
We do not offer, give or receive bribes or make improper payments, or participate in any kind of corrupt activity, either directly or through any third party.

Engaging in any form of bribery or corruption, even an allegation, can result in criminal proscecution and can seriously damage our reputation and our business relationships and is never acceptable.  We would rather miss out on business than take this risk.
Do not pay.  Take action immediately. Report the situation to your line manager and the legal department.
Record any details of the request (time, date, by whom and how it was asked for).

As you are in a negotiation process with this person, you should act with caution with a request such as this at this time in case it is a disguised bribe.  People tend to think of bribes as payments of cash or lavish gifts. In fact they are often far less obvious.

Bribery can include approving an irregular payment to win business and is an illegal practice even when done unintentionally. Being asked to sponsor or make a charitable donation can sometimes be a bribe. Engaging in any form of bribery can seriously damage our reputation and our business relationships. Under no circumstances will we ever encourage people even unintentionally to act improperly.

Whilst you may believe that the sponsorship / donation is requested with no ulterior motive it could be misinterpreted by others who could perceive it as a means to make you or your decisions biased, conflicted or obligated.  It is safer to decline than take the risk.
Sponsorship or charitable contributions using company funds should usually only be made to charities that have been nominated by the company.

Do not be embarrassed to ask to see evidence of the reason for the sponsorship / donation or to decline in supporting the charity. Doing so should not change the nature of your business relationship.  Decline in writing being open about the reasons for doing so using the reasons here.
Be transparent.  Report this request to your line manager.
